Package com.taco.suit_lady.view._nonimported

Class FxWeaverInitializer

java.lang.Object
com.taco.suit_lady.view._nonimported.FxWeaverInitializer
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventListener, org.springframework.context.ApplicationListener<FxWeaverInitializer.StageReadyEvent>
@Component public class FxWeaverInitializer extends Object implements org.springframework.context.ApplicationListener<FxWeaverInitializer.StageReadyEvent>

The ApplicationListener implementation triggered when the application Stage is fully initialized.


Note: There should only ever be a single instance of FxWeaverInitializer per JVM instance.

The FxWeaverInitializer instance is loaded and managed by the SpringFramework and should not be created manually using the new keyword.

Note: Spring Bean definition instructions are located in MainApplication.


See Also:
MainApplication.fxweaver(ConfigurableApplicationContext)

      public void onApplicationEvent​(FxWeaverInitializer.StageReadyEvent event)

      Handles FxWeaver initialization starting the FXApplication.


      Specified by:
      onApplicationEvent in interface org.springframework.context.ApplicationListener<FxWeaverInitializer.StageReadyEvent>
      Parameters:
      event - The implementation of ApplicationEvent containing the JavaFX data required for FxWeaver initialization.

    • weave

      boolean weave​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)

      Weaves a new Scene Instance into the specified Stage.


      Execution Process:

      1. A new JFX Controller instance is constructed.
      2. A new Scene is constructed using the JFX Controller initialization instructions and referenced FXML Template files .
      3. The Scene is assigned to the specified Stage.

      - The majority of the execution process is handled by either FxWeaver and/or the Spring Framework.


      Returns:
      True if the Scene instance generated by FxWeaver was properly loaded, linked to its JFX Controller, and weaved into the Stage.
      If, for any reason, any above the above operations fail, this method returns false.
